page.title: 10Ditchling's Medical Services
page.content: There is a doctor's surgery in the centre of Ditchling village,part of a Group Practice,with other surgeries in neighbouring villages.The surgery is open at least some time every weekday. The team looking after patients are 6 general practitioners, two nurses,a midwife, Health Visitor,psychiatric community nurse,chiropodist and 3 clerical staff.Villagers are referrred to Cuckfield Hospital and the Royal Sussex County Hospital at Brighton, both of which have accident and emerg_ ency departments and outpatient consultant clinics.The vicar organises a rota of helpers to collect prescrip_ tions from the chemist in the next village,and there is a 'good neighbour' scheme for visiting the sick and elderly.The W.R.V.S.organises twice weekly Meals on Wheels and prov_ ides transport to hospital.
